flash ( $  value )

flash Stores a string in the HTTPResponse objects flash storage, meaning it will be available on the next page load, and then will automatically be removed. Very useful for providing alerts to users.

Parameters:
string$value
Returns:
void
Author:
Matt Brewer
flash_contents (  )

flash_contents Retrieves the contents of flash storage, valid for the current request. Objects added to the flash storage during the current request will not be returned.

Returns:
array $contents
Author:
Matt Brewer
header ( $  str = null )

header Takes a string to use with the PHP header() function. Send headers to the browser this way and if the content is cached, the same headers will be sent when viewing the cached content

Parameters:
string$header
Returns:
(array|void) $headers

Matt Brewer

set ( $  key,
$  value 
)

set Assigns a value to a key, making the variable accessible inside the view context. Assigning a value to a key that already exists overwrites the previous value.

Parameters:
string$key
mixed$value
Deprecated:
1.3.6
Returns:
void
view ( $  str,
$  directory = VIEWS_PATH 
)

view If $str is a PHP file, the file is interpreted with all the data members set in the controller exposed locally If $str is any other type of file, the contents of the file are added to internal $content instance var If $str is not a file, $str is treated as a static string and added to the protected $content instance var

Parameters:
string$str
string$directory
Exceptions:
InvalidFileSystemPathExceptionif file is not accessible
Returns:
string $view_contents
Author:
Matt Brewer
